events.name: Deep Dive Into Deep Tech Startups
events.description: Join us for a deep dive with three NYC-based founders sharing insights on starting & joining a deep tech startup. Dinner & drinks available. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: The State Of Venture Capital
events.description: Venture capital firms are more selective & demanding when it comes to financing these days, especially with regard to first financings by early stage startups.  Join us for an informative panel where well be discussing questions & topics such as: - When does it make sense to start approaching venture capital firms for investment?- What does it take for a startup to raise its first priced round these days?  - What are early, growth, & late stage VCs investing in today?- What kind of business & financial metrics should a founder have in place before approaching venture firms for a priced round raise, whether Series Seed or Series A/B/C?- What do venture capitalists predict about the venture market for the remainder of 2025? Panelists: - Lindsey Mignano (SSM Law)- Naomi Goez (Forum Ventures)- Daniel Fleischmann (Timber Grove)- Pramod Gosavi  (Blumberg Capital)- Kevin Ye (Mach49) Moderator:-Christina Sclafani (TriNet) Food & Beverage Sponsors: Jacquelynne Suguitan, Christina Sclafani, & Grace Power of TriNet; Gadiel Morantes of Pilot; Calina Thompson of Safra National Bank; Lindsey Mignano of SSM Law; & Garrison Gowens of Cake Equity. By registering for this event, you herein agree to SSM's Privacy Policy (https://www.ssm.legal/privacy-policy.html) & Terms of Use (https://www.ssm.legal/terms-of-use.html). This event may be attended in person (if approved) or via Zoom (https://us06web.zoom.us/j/4810347305?pwd=dDhvblA3M1JEQTN1MkkyaEpvZzVjQT09) This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Uniting For Impact - Tech & AI For US
events.description: UNITING FOR IMPACT: Tech & AI for Public Health #NYTechWeek   CUNY SPH & KPMG US Mobilizing Startups, Government, Funders, & Industry to Solve America's Growing Public Health Crises with Technology & AI-Driven Solutions   UNITING FOR IMPACT is a networking event during NYC Tech Week co-hosted by KPMG US & Firefly Innovations, the nation's leading public health entrepreneurship platform at the top-ranked CUNY Graduate School of Public Health.   Over cocktails & hors d'oeuvres, this gathering convenes leaders across government, capital, industry, & innovation to confront America's escalating public health crises through technology, AI, & startup-driven solutions.   The event will spotlight the powerful partnership between Firefly Innovations & professional services firm KPMG US - an alliance that is driving record growth in the annual CUNY Public Health Innovation Accelerator program while expanding its reach & national impact.    Together, they are accelerating public health innovation to confront America's growing public health crises with bold, scalable solutions.   Join a community committed to building a healthier, more resilient nation - while advancing economic growth & strengthening the public health workforce through tech-driven innovation.   Learn more at Firefly-Innovations.org   This event is a part of #NYTechWeek - a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem.    Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.name: Trends & Tech In The Supply Chain
events.description: Join SAP for a conversation with leading supply chain & business journalists during New York Tech Week.  From tariffs & product shortages to the rise of AI & automated logistics, supply chains are making headlines  & reshaping the future of business. This exclusive event will explore the trends, technologies & tensions shaping global operations today, & what it means for companies across industries, especially those innovating in New Yorks dynamic tech & commerce landscape.  Moderated by Val Blatt, SAPs Chief Revenue Officer of Supply Chain Management, the panel will feature the top journalists driving the coverage  whats coming next, whats keeping supply chain leaders up at night, & how the stories get told. This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Visions Summit
events.description: About EventVISIONS Summit: NYC - Where Culture, Commerce, & the Future Converge Join us at the Museum of Modern Art for a one-day summit exploring the forces shaping the next era of commerce. Centered on this year's theme-We Are Builders of Worlds- the VISIONS Summit will explore mythmaking, design systems, brand legacy, & narrative strategy. The content is crafted to bring a fresh perspective to the retail & eCommerce landscape, inspiring marketing, CX, & innovation professionals to think beyond best practices & engage in meaningful transformation. Programmed by the editorial team at Future Commerce, this half-day event features a curated mix of keynotes, 1-on-1 interviews, & moderated panels with culture-shaping voices across media, creative arts, brand building, & technology. Through immersive storytelling, unexpected conversations, & cultural insight, this event is where the future gets built. This one-day-only experience will be held in the Roy & Niuta Titus Theater at the Museum of Modern Art, & only 200 guests will have the opportunity to attend. Full agenda & speakers can be viewed at futurecommerce.com/visions

events.name: Scaling Communities To Millions + AI
events.description: Join us for an intimate fireside chat where we dive deep into the art of scaling communities from 0 to millionswith real stories, hard-earned lessons, & actionable strategies from founders whove done it themselves. Siam Hossain, founder of Algorizin, scaled his community to over 200k members & built a 7-figure revenue businesshell share his playbook, the challenges he faced, & the key decisions that made all the difference in growing his community.  Then, well bring in the power of AI with Frederike Falke, founder of NYTech AI+, wholl break down how AI can supercharge your community growth in todays fast-moving landscape. Shell share her hands-on experiences building an AI community in New York & the strategies that actually work. This isnt just theoryits real tips from people whove been in the trenches. Well talk: Community growth  how to go from zero to a thriving, engaged audience Company growth (0-1)  the make-or-break moments in the early days AIs role in scaling  how to leverage tech to grow faster & smarter Challenges & learnings  the mistakes, pivots, & wins you need to know If youre a founder or just passionate about building communities, this is your chance to ask questions, get real answers, & walk away with tactics you can use immediately. No fluffjust honest, relatable stories & the kind of insights you wont find in a generic blog post. Come for the knowledge, stay for the connections, & leave ready to build something incredible. Lets make it happen - see you there! (This is a fireside chat, so bring your curiosity & lets keep it real.) This event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: AI x Finance Happy Hour
events.description: Join V7 & Andrew Yeung for an exclusive AI x Finance Happy Hour, bringing together the boldest minds shaping the future of tech & capital. We're curating a private gathering of 100 Finance Leaders, AI founders, fintech innovators, top investors, & influential voices for cocktails & light bites. Meet fellow leaders pushing the edge & actually implementing AI - hear real stories behind the hype & connect with other early adopters. Capacity is limited & invitations are non-transferable. ABOUT OUR HOSTS:V7 is an AI company headquartered in London with over $50 million raised & 80 strong team. With V7 Go we're building practical agentic automation for high-stakes verticals. Specifically built for teams in document heavy industries - think Financial Services, Insurance & Real Estate - V7 Go is helping companies deploy AI agents that automate intricate workflows like underwriting, due diligence, claims processing, & more. Today, V7 Go is used by some of the world's largest companies in financial services, insurance, healthcare & private markets. Andrew Yeung is the founder of Fibe (a portfolio of events companies including Andrew's Mixers, The Junto Series, & Lumos House). He is also a Partner at Next Wave NYC, a pre-seed/seed fund backed by Flybridge Capital. Andrew's hosted 100+ events for 30k+ tech founders & professionals in 8 cities that were featured in Bloomberg, Business Insider, Fast Company, & Fortune Magazine. Business Insider dubbed him the "Gatsby of Silicon Alley." This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

But that's exactly what's happening.Every expert you see on the card? They're going to be there-with you, in person, ready to dig in. CIM CITY: Deal Sourcing Mastery How top Searchers are finding deals-and what's actually working right now-brokered, proprietary, CRM-driven, & human-first.Featuring:  User Uploaded ImageDennis Unrein - SMB PE Kyle Griffith - The NYBB Group Chase Murdock - Decada Group / Durable George Wellmer - Tupelo SMB   FINANCIAL DILIGENCE BREAKDOWN Real-life QofE pitfalls, what to watch for, & how to stop falling for doctored cash flow. events.name: Bedrock Agents Workshop
events.description: Join us for a hands-on introduction to AI Agents, where you will learn to optimize task automation using generative AI. This session will demonstrate how these agents leverage foundation models to interpret complex requests, integrate with your APIs & data, & execute multistep workflows seamlessly.  Key highlights:  Multi-agent Collaboration: Coordinate specialized agents under a supervisor to manage intricate processes. RAG Integration: Provide accurate, data-supported responses through retrieval-augmented generation. Configuration: Build & customize agents efficiently with straightforward instructions.   Discover practical, real-world applications & gain the skills to transform workflows with AI-powered solutions that boost efficiency & elevate user experiences. Together, let us pave the way for intelligent automation.  This event features an interactive workshopplease bring your laptop if you wish to participate in the hands-on segment. Are you prepared to advance your organizations AI capabilities? Mark your calendar for June 9, 2025! High level schedule: 2:45 - 3:00: Arrivals 3:00 - 3:20: Presentation 3:20 - 4:20: Workshop 4:20 - 4:30: Wrap up & Q&A 4:30 - 5:00: Networking Bio: Udaya Jaladi is a Solutions Architect at AWS specializing in FinTech ISV customers. With over 16 years of experience, he has extensive expertise in designing & implementing enterprise applications across Sales, Services, Financial, HR, & Payroll domains. In his current role, he partners with customers to provide strategic guidance on building well-architected, AI-powered solutions on AWS. Udaya has developed deep expertise in Generative AI & helps organizations leverage this transformative technology to drive business innovation & efficiency Important instructions  Event starts at 3:00 pm EST, but please allow at least 15 minutes for security to process registration Please ensure that your meetup profile has your full name. Both first & last name are required & we will not be able to register attendees with just abbreviations or incomplete names. There is an optional networking & Q&A event at the end of the meetup

events.name: AI In Action - Driving Real Impact w/ AI
events.description: NY Tech Week | In-Person | Manhattan Ready to move beyond AI experiments & actually make it work for your business? Join Proximity Works for an executive workshop designed for leaders ready to move beyond experimentation & into real-world deployment. This isn't an introduction to AI - it's a hands-on deep dive into implementing AI agents, automation, & GenAI solutions in weeks, not months. Discover how leading companies automated operations, increased output by 10x, & launched AI agents at speed. No buzzwords. Just practical, ROI-focused strategies from the team behind AI deployments at some of the world's biggest companies globally. If you're building the AI roadmap for your company, this is your room. Why Attend? AI Agents in Action: See how companies are using AI agents to automate ops, accelerate workflows, & boost output - at scale. We'll unpack real-world systems that: Reduced manual ops by 80% Increased content output by 10x Went from scope  MVP  scale in weeks, not quarters From Idea to ROI: Learn how to identify high-impact opportunities & move fast - from prototype to production. Cut Through the Noise: Understand what actually works-co-pilots, RAG, model fine-tuning, orchestration-and where to avoid the hype. Battle-Tested Strategies: Walk through real use cases that reduced manual effort by 80% & increased content output 10x. Learn from common pitfalls & uncover additional strategies gleaned from actual deployments. Network Intentionally: Connect with CXOs, founders, & product leaders who are actively investing in AI & innovation. What You'll Walk Away With 1 x AI Strategy Consultation Session with Proximity's AI Experts A clear, customized AI roadmap framework built around measurable ROI Strategic playbooks to launch AI agents across ops, content, CX, & internal workflows Clarity on GenAI, co-pilots, & orchestration tools - & how to fit them into your stack Who Should Attend Founders, CEOs, CTOs, Heads of Product, & Innovation leaders across industries - especially those with $50M-$500M in revenue, mid-to-high digital maturity, & a strong mandate to scale AI with real outcomes. About Proximity Works Born in Silicon Valley, built for real-world scale. We help brands like Disney+, ESPN, & Cars24 build & deploy applied AI-fast. Our embedded AI strike teams combine senior ML engineers, architects, & strategists to deliver MVPs in weeks & enterprise rollouts in months. No fluff, no demos-just execution that moves the needle. We build systems that move KPIs-fast. Workshop Agenda 11:00 AM - 11:15 AM: Welcome Check-in Hello & introductions Snacks & refreshments 11:15 AM - 11:30 AM: Opening Remarks Overview of Proximity Works & the AI Strategy Workshop Walkthrough of the event's theme & agenda 11:30 AM - 12:30 PM: Strategy Workshop 11:30 PM - 1:00 PM: Interactive Q&A Engage with speakers & peers on AI strategies & challenges 1:00 PM - 1:30 PM: Closing Remarks & Networking Summary of key takeaways Final thoughts & next steps Networking opportunity with fellow executives & AI experts Space is limited-register your interest today, & we'll notify you soon if your registration is approved! This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Growth Mindset Founders Breakfast
events.description: This NY Tech Week, take a breath. A-Players is hosting an intimate morning gathering for Series A-stage founders & investors, featuring a guided mindfulness session led by Irka Ryabaya (ex-Goldman Sachs), a mental health coach & former founder herself.  You'll reflect on your journey, connect with peers through thoughtful dialogue, & enjoy a curated breakfast with others who understand the highs & lows of scaling a startup. With a network of 650+ founders & partnerships with top VCs, A-Players creates highly curated, private events designed to foster real connections & shared growth. We are proud to partner with Stifel Venture Bank & TriNet for this event. Stifel Financial (NYSE: SF) is a global investment bank, wealth management, & commercial banking institution with $400B+ in AUM. Stifel Bank offers venture & fund banking solutions, including 100% free banking for fund clients, fully insured liquid ICS accounts (up to $250MM FDIC coverage), capital call & management company lines of credit, & venture lending. Learn more at https://bankwithstifel.com/venture-banking/ Raising money from investors requires you to show you can run a business. You need a full-service HR solution tailored for growing technology companies. With decades of experience & roots in Silicon Valley, TriNet provides HR expertise to help you grow your company & stay compliant. By working with them, you can focus on what's important-raising capital, launching innovative solutions & scaling your team. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Startup Pitch Mixer
events.description: Agenda6:00 PM - 6:30 PM Registration Guests register, receive badges, & event programs. This is an opportunity for casual networking, making first connections, & preparing for the event.6:30 PM - 7:30 PM Event Kickoff & Interactive Networking Official welcome from the organizers with a brief overview of the event goals & schedule. Interactive networking helps participants set their objectives & connect with key contacts.7:40 PM - 8:20 PM Startup Pitch Session Startups present their projects to investors & experts. Each team has 5 minutes to pitch, covering the project's core idea, business model, & target market.8:20 PM - 9:00 PM Chill & Networking Participants enjoy casual conversations with investors, discuss collaborations, & exchange ideas over refreshments. Hi there! Dear Participants! Join our event in NYC Manhattan!Meet & get acquainted with Startup Founders, Business Professionals & Investors. Pitch to the audience with your project & seize your chance to dive into the world of business, technology, & venture capital.  Why You Can't-Miss It:Engage with leading experts & founders in the Tech & Business, & top investors to gain deep insights & valuable networking. This event is a must-attend for those looking to gain ideas, experience, & valuable connections.  Present Your Startup in the Tech & Business:Showcase your startup in the Tech & Business! Email your pitch deck to contact.us@startupvalley.club & seize the opportunity to impress both the audience & investors! Also, you need to fill out the application to participate as a pitcher/speaker at the event. Apply now!  We Welcome New Investors:We invite investors to our event to expand their network, get acquainted with new startups, evaluate them, provide their feedback, participate in discussions, & gain access to a database of new & promising startups from around the world. If you're interested in attending our event as an investor, please register through this link If you'd like access to a database of promising startup projects & additional benefits from Startup Valley, please fill out this application, & our team will contact you: this link Startup Presentations in the Tech & Business & Expert Evaluations:Startups from various industries, prepare for your moment of glory with a 5-minute presentation scheduled for 07:40 PM, followed by invaluable feedback from our panel of venture capitalists & angel investors. Who will you meet at the event:FoundersInvestors or VC companiesMarketers, Salespeople, Business AdvisersGame changersAI ExpertsEntrepreneurs from Europe, Asia, & the United KingdomRequirements to attendants:Neat appearanceGood mood1 drink bought at the bar (non-alcohol works too)The venue where we host our events is our partner. To continue hosting events at this location, please consider purchasing 1-2 drinks at the bar. Thank you. Time:Event time: 6:00 -9:00PM Pitch time: 7:40 -8:20 PM Join our event, & secure your ticket today!Sincerely, Startup Valley

events.name: Fund Design For Mortals - Healthtech LP GP Dinner
events.description: An LP/GP Dinner hosted by MarkOne Health & sponsored by JP Morgan Healthcare Banking.nIn an era where 84% of healthcare VC exits fall below $650M & 42% fall below $150M, the pursuit of billion-dollar unicorns increasingly resembles a lottery ticket strategy.nThis dinner confronts the reality that mid-market exits ($80M$250M) now represent healthcares most replicable liquidity path. This gathering will bring together healthcare GPs & LPs for a thoughtful conversation around M&A trends, fund design, capital strategy, & alignment of LP & GP goals  & as a result better outcomes for LPs, GPs, & founders.nnTo apply to participate, you must currently be either the GP or MP of a healthtech focused fund or a current LP into the same. nnParticipation will be limited to 12 each from the LP & GP side.

events.name: Startup Lean Coffee
events.description: Startup Lean Coffee is a community of over 500 founders, employees, advisors, & investors. Our sole purpose is to help each other continuously improve by sharing some of the questions, concerns, challenges, opportunities, & experiences that we have all encountered in our startup journeys.nnWe follow a Lean Coffee format: a fun, lightly facilitated meeting in which you suggest & vote on the topics that are of interest to you to build the agenda; & we discuss topics for a fixed time, voting to continue discussion or move on to the next topic after the time runs out.nnBecause our theme is startups, pretty much any topic goes! Our previous topics have varied widely, from fundraising & social equity to lean product experiments & development shops to technical co-founders & psychedelic-induced flow states.nnAll you need to bring is your attention, curiosity, & willingness to share. A light breakfast will even be provided. Oh, & don't forget to bring a photo ID & allow time to go through building security.nStartup Lean Coffee is sponsored by Foley Hoag LLP.nThis event is a part of #NYTechWeeka week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Discover with Quadrant Technologies, Microsoft, & AMD how Azure's powerful platform can streamline & secure your PostgreSQL databases, no matter where they run-on-premises, in multi-cloud setups, or at the edge.

events.name: Building Emotional Support Systems w/ AI
events.description: This isn't just another tech panel-join us for an intimate, women-led roundtable exploring how AI can support emotional wellbeing, digital balance, & addiction recovery in today's high-pressure, hyperconnected world. This gathering will break into small, thoughtfully curated groups to spark honest conversations, not lectures. Together with 50 mission-driven technologists, builders, & community leaders, we'll dive deep into designing a more compassionate digital future.  Core topics we'll explore: How AI can offer non-judgmental, always-on emotional support Rethinking digital wellness & social media through a gender-inclusive lens Exploring voice vs. text agents for crisis care Designing pro-user algorithms that empower attention-not exploit it Our hosts:EchoHer is a non-profit organization dedicated to empowering women & non-binary founders & funders by increasing their representation & success in entrepreneurship. We foster a supportive ecosystem to drive meaningful change & create impactful opportunities through monthly events, co-working opportunities, curated networking sessions, pitch nights, & insightful panel discussions. PowerYou is an AI-powered companion for emotional healing & wellbeing. Designed for people navigating addiction, burnout, or self-doubt, it offers daily support through guided reflection, personalized action plans, & a warm, human-like AI guide named Kris. We imagine a world where no one has to suffer alone in their hardest moments - because the support they need is right in their pocket. Already ready to listen. Always learning. Always there. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: ROI Of Clean Code
events.description: Business CasualDrinks & SnacksSoftware shapes the world - & it shapes your business. As software becomes more critical to business strategy, the systems behind it are under pressure & the long-term cost of unsustainable code is mounting.  ABOUT THE EVENTJoin leaders from JPMorgan Chase, the London Stock Exchange Group, a16z, OWASP, & Software Improvement Group (SIG) for an insight-packed session on how sustainable software is becoming a key driver of business resilience, scale, & innovation. You'll hear from technical, strategic, & policy voices on how to:  Define & measure software sustainability in real terms Align C-suite vision with development execution Shift quality left in the development lifecycle Navigate GenAI's long-term impact on software practices Leverage sustainable systems as a competitive & compliance advantage  WHO IS THIS EVENT FOR?Designed for both engineering & business leaders, this session combines real-world insights with strategic foresight - & features key findings from SIG's upcoming State of Software 2025 report, including industry-specific benchmarks.  AGENDA3:00 PM - Arrival & Welcome 3:30 PM - Opening Remarks & 2025 Industry InsightsLuc Brandts, CEO, SIG 3:40 PM - Keynote | Sustainable Software Engineering: From Intention to ExecutionPepijn Senders, Head of Innovation, SIG 4:10 PM - Panel DiscussionSpeakers from LSEG, JPMorgan Chase, a16z, OWASP, & SIG Engineering, business, & policy perspectives on software sustainability 4:30 PM - Audience Q&A 4:45 PM - Snacks, Drinks & Networking Whether you own the roadmap or the revenue, this conversation will reshape how you think about software's role in driving growth.  For more information, visit www.softwareimprovementgroup.com This event is part of #NYTechWeek - a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

Business CasualDrinks & SnacksSoftware shapes the world - & it shapes your business. As software becomes more critical to business strategy, the systems behind it are under pressure & the long-term cost of unsustainable code is mounting.  ABOUT THE EVENTJoin leaders from JPMorgan Chase, the London Stock Exchange Group, a16z, OWASP, & Software Improvement Group (SIG) for an insight-packed session on how sustainable software is becoming a key driver of business resilience, scale, & innovation. You'll hear from technical, strategic, & policy voices on how to:  Define & measure software sustainability in real terms Align C-suite vision with development execution Shift quality left in the development lifecycle Navigate GenAI's long-term impact on software practices Leverage sustainable systems as a competitive & compliance advantage  WHO IS THIS EVENT FOR?Designed for both engineering & business leaders, this session combines real-world insights with strategic foresight - & features key findings from SIG's upcoming State of Software 2025 report, including industry-specific benchmarks.  AGENDA3:00 PM - Arrival & Welcome 3:30 PM - Opening Remarks & 2025 Industry InsightsLuc Brandts, CEO, SIG 3:40 PM - Keynote | Sustainable Software Engineering: From Intention to ExecutionPepijn Senders, Head of Innovation, SIG 4:10 PM - Panel DiscussionSpeakers from LSEG, JPMorgan Chase, a16z, OWASP, & SIG Engineering, business, & policy perspectives on software sustainability 4:30 PM - Audience Q&A 4:45 PM - Snacks, Drinks & Networking Whether you own the roadmap or the revenue, this conversation will reshape how you think about software's role in driving growth.  For more information, visit www.softwareimprovementgroup.com This event is part of #NYTechWeek - a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. events.name: AI In Space - Exploring Future Of Data, Discovery & Design
events.description: A Space Apps NYC 2025 Preview Event Join us for a dynamic, multi-speaker session previewing Space Apps NYC 2025-where curiosity meets code & cosmic questions become collaborative experiments. This event brings together NASA datasets, AI-powered workflows, & mind-expanding applications of space science. Hear from: Cloudflare on how AI is reshaping coding workflows & developer productivity Steven Jaret (AMNH) on decoding the story of our solar system through meteorite research Michael Caprio (Tesla Science Center) on Open Space, a 3D platform visualizing real NASA mission data And more voices exploring how open data & public science can fuel both education & innovation Whether you're a student, scientist, coder, or community builder-this is your launchpad to get involved, get inspired, & get ready for this year's Space Apps challenge. In an age of AI & institutional uncertainty, the next generation of civic & tech leaders needs more than just skills-they need to practice working across silos, building with clarity, & designing for meaning. That's what Space Apps + SWARM is. Not just a hackathon. A year-long civic sandbox for: students to grow orgs to connect problems to get visible systems to be made legible and life to improve on Earth & in space Pizza & light refreshments will be served. Community Partners:

events.name: Sky-High Pitch Competition
events.description: A curated & mindful Tech Week gathering for Founders, Builders, & Believers. We're set for an experience like no other-where modern wellness meets cutting-edge tech, & Apollo Society collides with Rocket Mixer to create something extraordinary in one of the most beautiful & serene places in New York - Edge's Outdoor Deck. First off, we are going to start our morning with a guided breathwork session by Apollo Society. That's when we take a moment to relax, recharge our minds & bodies, & enjoy the stunning view of NYC! With focus sharpened, the pitch competition begins. 10 founders will deliver elevator pitches to a panel of top investors. The top three move on to a finale round, where they'll pitch again in more detail & receive deeper feedback.  The winner receives: $2,500 Draper House credit for global stays, programs, or funding opportunities Private Breakfast with top VCs, investors & cultural leaders Mito Health Biomarker Testing ($500 value) for optimized performance Lazo Premium Package: 2-year subscription, free business incorporation, & more Priority Access to future Apollo Society & Rocket Mixer events  Every attendee will receive: Full Othership Signature Experience Pass - Includes guided breathwork, sauna, & ice bath journey - a complete mind-body reset. Wellness Gifts Curated by Apollo Society partners to elevate your self-care ritual. Startup Support from Lazo: 6-month subscription to Lazo One + 50% off tax & bookkeeping services. Networking with Top Founders & Investors Priceless connections designed to inspire, elevate, & expand your journey.  Panel of Top Investors: Nicole Newman Enslein, Loeb.nyc, Sublime Communications Slava Rubin, Indiegogo, Nillion Jenn Bonine, Valhalla Capital Mike Schulte, Loeb.nyc, Great North Ventures Patrick Tsang, Chairman Tsangs Group a16z  Program Schedule 7:00 AM - Guest Check-In7:15 AM - Guided Breathwork Session7:45 AM - Light Snack & Refresh8:00 AM - Pitch Competition Kickoff8:45 AM - Highlights & Winner Announcement9:00 AM - Event Closing - Let's Keep Building!9:30 AM - Private Breakfast with Leading VCs & Investors (place to be announced) Whether you come to pitch your startup, connect with investors, or simply to be among the most intentional minds of the week - this experience is for you. So guys- all the way up! See you at the top-100th floor. Apollo Society & Rocket Mixer Team    Key Info Before You Join  Pitch Competition:To apply, purchase a ticket, & fill out the application form.Note: Due to high volume, not all applicants will be selected, but all ticket holders can attend the event.  Ticket Tiers:Early Bird - $45 (limited until May 20) Discounted access for early movers. General Admission - $75Includes entry to the Edge Observation Deck, guided breathwork, curated networking, & a one-of-a-kind pitch event. Premium - $120All of the above plus access to a private breakfast with investors, VIP guests, & organizers.  Please Note:Tickets are non-refundable unless the event is canceled or significantly rescheduled. The event will be photographed & filmed - by attending, you consent to your image being used for promotional purposes.

events.name: Investher Roundtables
events.description: InvestHer Roundtables: Show Her The Money! Join INPINK, Stella Foundation, & Show Her The Money Film as we bring together female investors/VC leaders, founders from all backgrounds, & the tech community - for a roundtable discussion, refreshments, complimentary headshots, & more! Investors & VC leaders from various backgrounds, from early to growth/late stages, will speak on various topics. Event Schedule:2 PM - Doors Open / Show Her The Money Film Screening3:30 PM - Film Panel4 PM- InvestHer Roundtables5 PM - Mixer with DJ Loa/Happy Hour/Open Bar Open Bar courtesy of Jackson McCrea Whiskey, Owls Brew, Waterloo Sparkling, Fast Penny Spirits, For Bitter For Worse, & more! Food provided by Bareburger Show Her The Money Panel:Catherine Gray (GP Silicon Valley Women Founders Fund, Exec Prod of Show Her The Money) John Majeski (GP Silicon Valley Women Founders Fund,Associate Producer - Show Her The Money  Silvia Mah (Founder of Stella foundation, Associate Producer - Show Her The Money) Jason Hammond (Vice President & Business Partner Manager,Fidelity Private Shares) Moderator Jacquie Duval (Partner, Perkins Coie) InvestHER Roundtables/Panel: Jennifer K. Mandelbaum (Partner, Halogen Ventures) Melissa Withers (Managing Partner & Co-Founder,RevUp Capital) Evi Heilbrunn (Founder & CEO, Peach Health Ventures) Moderator Shira Yevin (Founder & CEO, Gritty In Pink) More panelists to be announced. This 21+ event is sponsored by INPINK, Stella Foundation, & Show Her The Money. Hosted by Gritty In Pink founder, Shira Yevin. Gritty In Pink is building INPINK, a global destination for hiring female freelancers, starting with the music industry. The INPINK marketplace connects the music business with a diverse community of female creators & pros. Our lead investor is Live Nation. Stella Foundation, founded in 2012, connects women founders & investors to the right resource-at the right time-in their journeys. From ideation to funding to exit, women founders & investors look to Stella for its powerful constellation of support made up of an inclusive community, courses, access to capital events, advisory services, & funding opportunities. SHOW HER THE MONEY - This is a story that's never been told. SHOW HER THE MONEY addresses how women are getting less than 2% of venture capital funding & demystifies what venture capital is. Featuring rock-star female investors who invest in diverse women entrepreneurs with innovations that will change the world, Show Her The Money reminds us that money is power & women need it to achieve true equality. Follow @grittyinpinklife on Instagram, & visit the website INPINK.com for more company info. We recommend getting there right at 2 PM movie & 4 PM for Roundtables, as we foresee this event reaching capacity. Entry will be FREE RSVP with log in to INPINK at the door. This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com

events.description: Gam3 On: Chelsea Testnet Launch for Soneium's Gaming L3  Join us at New York Tech Week, on June 4th, 2-4 PM as we unveil Chelsea, the testnet launch of our groundbreaking Gaming L3 on Soneium. This marks a major milestone for the future of onchain gaming - designed for performance, scale, & seamless developer experience. This exclusive event will be split into two power-packed sessions followed by networking & mingling.  Part 1: Technical Panel (2:00 - 2:30 PM) Diving into Web3 Gaming Infrastructure & Chelsea Testnet Hear from leading builders & researchers on the next evolution of gaming blockchains, & how Chelsea sets the stage for what's next.  Part 2: Investor Panel (2:30 - 3:00 PM) Funding Web3 Gaming: Round 2 A candid discussion with top investors on where capital is flowing, what's changed in gaming VC, & what's now in the spotlight.  Networking (3:00 - 4:00 PM) Meet fellow founders, devs, investors, & ecosystem builders. Drinks, alpha, & Chelsea testnet invites await. discussions about the latest trends in blockchain technology & explore the future of gaming. Every conversation could ignite the next groundbreaking idea-don't miss out on this exclusive opportunity to network. This event is proudly sponsored by a16z & WeWork. We extend our sincere thanks for their generous support. About Blockus Blockus is your all in one platform for Web3 gaming, enabling game studios to build fast, reduce costs & laser focus on gameplay.  Blockus provides seamlessly integrated Wallet-as-a-service account + wallet management, first party NFT marketplace, & fiat + crypto payments.  website | Twitter | LinkedIn About Soneium Soneium, an Ethereum layer-2 developed by Sony Block Solutions Labs, is a versatile general-purpose blockchain platform that aims to evoke emotion, empower creativity, & realize the open internet that transcends boundaries. By transcending cultural differences & bringing together people with diverse values, Soneium reimagines how we interact with the internet, opening up a world of innovative applications that fill the world with emotion. Website | X | Discord | Telegram This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. Learn more at www.tech-week.com.

events.name: Open-Source NYC Computer Vision Hackathon w/ Moondream
events.description: New York never sleeps - & for 48 electrifying hours neither will you. Arm yourself with edge devices, camera modules, Moondream's lightning-fast 1 GB vision model, & whatever other hardware Jon can find on eBay (within budget). Tap directly into NYC's trove of open data - live traffic cams, 311 rodent alerts, taxi heat-maps, building blueprints - to transform every curb, crosswalk, & alleyway into a programmable canvas. We're wiring the city itself into your codebase. From flash-fire prototypes that untangle gridlock to edge-powered detectors that spotlight the city's next rat hotspot, this hackathon is your shot to prove how tiny models & civic data can make the five boroughs smarter overnight. No GPUs, no red tape, just pure hustle & open-source impact in the Big Apple  Theme - Edge Vision  NYC Open Data From curb-level transit analytics to automatic rodent recognition, teams must blend on-device inference, public datasets, & their imagination to create useful products for the urban landscape. Show how lightweight models + open data can make the city safer, cleaner, smarter, & even more New York

events.name: MetaProp Accelerator Demo Day
events.description: Join us in NYC for MetaProp's 2025 Demo Day on June 17th. Be among the first to meet the next generation of PropTech innovators as the six startups in MetaProp's latest Accelerator cohort take the stage. This exclusive event brings together top investors, industry leaders, & select media to hear firsthand from visionary founders tackling the real estate industry's most pressing challenges. June 17, 20259:00 AM - 12:00 PM ESTMidtown Manhattan (RSVP for address) If you have any questions, please get in touch with Evan Petitt at epetitt@metaprop.com. This marquee event has limited space & fills up fast every year. 2025 Cohort BUILDRFI (Miami) - BuildrFi streamlines financial workflows for construction by offering a clear view of project cash flows & financing options, helping to manage material costs & delayed payments. FRAM ENERGY (NYC) - Fram Energy makes solar deployment for multifamily & single-family rentals profitable & effortless through tenant energy billing software. POPWHEELS (NYC) - PopWheels is revolutionizing urban mobility in America with its e-bike battery swap network, starting with the 80,000+ delivery workers in NYC. PROPRISE (SF) - PropRise is an AI-driven commercial real estate deal sourcing platform, transforming how firms discover & evaluate opportunities. ULAMA (NYC) - Ulama is AI-powered code compliance that automates the approval of construction permit applications. WEALTHIE (NYC) - Wealthie builds more wealth for homeowners by investing home equity in diversified assets without loans or debt.

events.name: AI Founders - The Good, The Bad, The Unknown
events.description: Join us for a candid & inspiring panel discussion at our AI Founders Panel: The Good, The Bad, The Unknown. This unique session brings together visionary founders who are navigating the unprecedented AI revolution happening right now. Our panelists will share their personal stories of building AI companies during this transformative period, discussing both the extraordinary opportunities & distinctive challenges of founding an AI venture in today's rapidly evolving landscape. Attendees will gain rare insights into how these founders are making real-time decisions amid shifting technological capabilities, regulatory environments, & market dynamics. Whether you're building your own AI startup, considering entering the space, or simply fascinated by how entrepreneurs are shaping this technological revolution, this panel offers a window into the minds of those writing the history of AI entrepreneurship as we speak. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from founders who are actively defining what it means to build AI companies during one of the most significant technological transitions of our lifetime. Our Event Agenda: 17:00-17:15 - Welcome & Introduction of Panelists Host: Dr.Nick Gu, Applied AI TL, Android, Google 17:15-18:30 - Panel Discussion: Navigating Current AI Landscape for Founders - Speaker (Pending): Joseph Varghese, Founder, 3dayai/Success Circle- Speaker: Trista Van Tine, Founder, Nunchi AI, Michigan Tech Week- Speaker: Andrew Hoh, Co-Founder, LastMile AIMore to come! 18:30-19:00 - Open Q&A with Audience This event is a part of #NYTechWeek-a week of events hosted by VCs & startups to bring together the tech ecosystem. events.name: Building Capitol - AI Startups Political Advocacy Luncheon
events.description: Join AWS Public Policy at New York Tech Week for:Building Capitol: AI Startups Political Advocacy Luncheon  For too long, startups & entrepreneurs have been shut out of the rooms where innovation policy gets made. At AWS, we believe that startups & small businesses are not just key drivers of economic growth-they embody the spirit of American exceptionalism. Your insights, challenges, & experiences should play a defining role in shaping the policies that will determine the future of innovation in the U.S. & beyond. At AWS, we recognize our responsibility to help elevate the voices of startups in these critical discussions. We are committed to working alongside the startups that build on AWS to ensure their perspectives are heard. Through partnerships, direct engagement, & advocacy, we are helping connect startups with policymakers, ensuring that their insights inform the decisions that shape the technology landscape. You'll gain: Insights on the DC tech policy state of play.Strategies for talking to lawmakers to build regulations for startups, by startups.Networking opportunities to connect with industry & AWS public policy leaders.Don't miss this chance to expand your professional network & raise political capital.Registration Information: Due to high demand & limited capacity, submitting a registration does not guarantee entry. All RSVPs will be reviewed & approved on a weekly basis, with confirmation emails being sent to approvals. Agenda 9:00 PM GMT+5:30 Registration & Networking 9:30 PM GMT+5:30 Welcome Remarks 9:45 PM GMT+5:30 Lunch & Roundtable Discussion Topics 11:00 PM GMT+5:30 Open Discussion & Networking

events.name: Petrov Day
events.description: "Wherever you are, whatever you're doing, take a minute to not destroy the world." https://www.lesswrong.com/posts/QtyKq4BDyuJ3tysoK/9-26-is-petrov-day https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Man_Who_Saved_the_World Ways to celebrate: * Screening of the film "The Man Who Saved The World"? (It's pretty good!) * X-risk discussion meetup? * Call your representatives to express your views on any upcoming nuclear risk-related bills?

events.name: World Longevity Day
events.description:
These nice people keep track of Longevity Day celebrations around the world:

http://www.longevityhistory.com/longevity-day-and-longevity-month/

...but while people are living longer every year, there haven't been more Longevity Day celebrations every year. If that seems "off" to you, why not host one yourself? And then tell the folks at LongevityHistory.com!

The website has records of past events, which may offer ideas for how to celebrate. If you have any cool ideas of your own, let us know: alexrk@effectivealtruism.nyc

venue.address: Worldwide!

events.name: World Vegetarian Day
events.description:
"To promote the joy, compassion and life-enhancing possibilities of vegetarianism."


https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Vegetarian_Day


Also the beginning of Vegetarian Awareness Month -- though it's never a bad time to be aware of the vegetarians around you!

venue.address: Worldwide!

events.name: World Vegan Day
events.description:
The perfect day to eat all of your Halloween candy! (No milk chocolate, though.)

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Vegan_Day

events.name: Happy birthday, Giving What We Can!
events.description: Giving What We Can was officially founded on November 14th, 2009. Every anniversary represents a few hundred more people (and in the future, perhaps even larger numbers) who have committed a substantial fraction of their income to helping others effectively. Huzzah!

events.name: Smallpox Eradication Day
events.description:
http://effective-altruism.com/ea/1t5/500_million_but_not_a_single_one_more/


500 million people died, but we turned "Smallpox is" into "Smallpox was". This is one of our species' greatest victories over suffering; it's a good time to celebrate and to remember.
.

events.name: Derek Parfit's Birthday!
events.description:
Derek Parfit was perhaps the greatest moral philosopher of the 20th century, in how he shaped the discipline and raised important new questions. 

He gave us the Repugnant Conclusion and the Hitchhiker's Dilemma, and put a plug for giving 10% into On What Matters, his masterpiece. Had he lived long enough to finish another volume, he had plans to discuss existential risk and dive deeper into questions of how we ought to act.

How to celebrate Parfit's life and work? You could discuss population ethics, philosophize about something else, or consider, as a group, ways to make your lives slightly more rational. (Or just eat cake and sing Happy Birthday and engage in idle, friendly conversation; Parfit surely wouldn't object.)

events.name: John Snow's Birthday!
events.description:
No, not the George R. R. Martin one. The one who helped found epidemiology!

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/John_Snow


Celebrate today by drinking clean water!

events.name: Norman Borlaug's Birthday!
events.description:
How can you celebrate an agronomist who fed billions?

...we're not sure yet, but maybe you can make something tasty with GMO wheat flour?

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norman_Borlaug

events.name: World Health Day
events.description:
Some say that April is the cruelest month. The WHO begs to differ:

http://www.who.int/campaigns/world-health-day/2018/en/

Speaking of April, keep an eye out for World Malaria Day and World Immunization Week later this month.

No matter what year you read this, it's probably the healthiest year in human history. Let's celebrate, and keep the streak going!

NYC Resistor is open to the public for Craft Nights now every Monday and Thursday from 6:30-9:30 PM! Come bring your current crafting project and work on it with other artists, crafters, and makers of all kinds. Resistors do everything from costumes to electronics to visual arts to woodworking; people and crafting projects of all sorts are enthusiastically welcome!

RSVP at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/public-craft-night-mondays-and-thursdays-tickets-162729866411 is appreciated but not required, for covid contact-tracing purposes.

This event like all NYC Resistor events is 18 and over and governed by out code of conduct.

events.name: Delete Your Account: How to ditch X and Elon with Cyd
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/delete-your-account-how-to-ditch-x-and-elon-with-cyd-tickets-1344394272459

Twitter was never good. X is worse. We'll show you how to archive your tweets with Cyd, then delete your content from Elon's website.Remember Twitter, aka the Hellsite? It was terrible, but at least it wasn't owned by a dude who likes making "roman salutes." After you divest from your SpaceX stock and sell your Tesla, come on down to NYC Resistor, where we'll show you how to ditch X but keep a personal copy of your favorite posts using Cyd.
Before the workshop: Make sure you can log on to X on your laptop (not your phone, your laptop) and once logged in, request an archive of your tweets using these instructions: https://help.x.com/en/managing-your-account/how-to-download-your-x-archive. Please do this step at least a week before the workshop, as it may take X a few to several days to process the archive request.BONUS: We'll also help you sign up for Mastodon, an X alternative, if you want.
This event is donate what-you-wish.
This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.

events.name: Learn to Use a Laser Cutter to Cut and Etch Your Own Designs
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/learn-to-use-a-laser-cutter-to-cut-and-etch-your-own-designs-tickets-1369929579249

Harness the power of an Epilog 60 Watt Laser! In this class you'll learn everything you need.Harness the power of an Epilog 60 Watt Laser! In this class you'll learn everything you need to know to make the ideas in your head become a reality with a laser.
In this three hour class, you will learn:
How to set up a file for cutting on the laser cutter in Inkscape or Adobe Illustrator.Laser cutter safety including materials testing.Laser cutter operation including configuration, cuts and raster etching in common materials like wood, acrylic, cardboard and others.At the end of class, you will go home with:
One laser cut project, either the class default or a simple one of your own design (see below for details)Resistor Laser Certification, enabling you to use our laser on Craft Nights.Please bring the following to class:
A laptop with either Inkscape (free: download here: https://inkscape.org/release/inkscape-1.2.1/) or Adobe Illustrator installed.
A USB jump drive
The following items are optional if you'd like to try cutting a simple custom design. If your file ends up being too complicated, we may have you do the class default project first, just to learn the laser in the time allotted - but we'll definitely help you with your more complex cut at a free Craft Night in future!
An SVG vector file of a simple shape you'd like to cut for your first cut.A piece of 1/8 inch or thinner wood, acrylic or cardboard you'd like to cut. If you can't bring your own material, small pieces will be made available, or larger pieces for purchase on site.Please be on time for the start of class! If you're late you will miss your slot.
This class will be taught by NYC Resistor member Katie. As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.
Please note that refunds must be requested 72 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

events.name: Intro to Soldering Workshop: Make an LED Tile
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/intro-to-soldering-workshop-make-an-led-tile-tickets-1369929639429

Soldering is one of the most important skills you'll need for working with electronics. Come join us for an introductory through-hole solderSoldering is one of the most important skills you'll need for working with electronics. Come join us for an introductory through-hole soldering workshop. Soldering enables you to create sturdy connections between electrical components. In this hands-on workshop, you'll learn how to use a soldering iron safely and effectively, and get plenty of practice with both soldering and de-soldering techniques. We'll be soldering up some Game of Life kits - LED tiles that generate nifty animations. No previous experience is required, making this introductory workshop a great choice for anyone who's curious about getting started with hardware tinkering! All materials will be provided.
OK, awesome, I want to join!
Please be ready to start at 1pm! We find that you will need this time to get through the whole class. Our classes tend to sell out about a week in advance so if you're interested, you may want to sign up early.
This class will be taught by Resistor member Raphael.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/. events.description:
Vaccination Proof + Mask + RSVP Required
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/nycresistor-ham-radio-club-tickets-1113096554759

Monthly Amateur Radio club meeting of NYCResistorRadio curious? Join the NYC Resistor Ham Radio Club (call sign N2YCR) for our open and regular meetings, the 4th Wednesday of each month from 8:00 – 9:30 pm at NYC Resistor (87 3rd Avenue, 4th Floor).
The amateur radio hobby has something for everyone, from Morse code to modern digital modes. Bring projects you're working on, gear to fix, problems that puzzle you, outings you'd like to organize, or just yourself to meet & greet your friendly local hams. Drop by the #n2ycr channel in Discord any time to say hi.
You do not need to be a member of Resistor to be a member of the club, nor do you need to be a licensed amateur radio operator (though of course we hope you'll become licensed with our help).
We aim to create an inclusive, encouraging, and diverse environment to bring together Brooklyn's radio hackers, antenna experimenters, shortwave listeners, toroid winders, satellite chasers, and balloon launchers.
Come make some noise in the weird and wonderful medium of radio!This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.

events.name: Synthesizer Night @ NYC Resistor
events.description:
RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/synthesizer-night-nyc-resistor-tickets-1374984639069

Gathering musicians, enthusiasts, and curious minds to connect, collaborate, and share their passion for synthesis. BYO synth encouraged!Join us at NYC Resistor, a makerspace in Brooklyn for an electrifying Synthesizer Night! Get ready to unleash your creativity, explore sonic landscapes, and connect with fellow synth enthusiasts in an evening dedicated to the mesmerizing world of synthesizers. This is a pay-what-you-wish event (recommended donation $8).
Synthesizer Night at NYC Resistor is a celebration of all things synthesizer. Whether you're a seasoned musician, an avid collector, or simply fascinated by the possibilities of electronic sound, this event offers a unique opportunity to gather with like-minded individuals and revel in the captivating soundscape of synthesizers.
At Synthesizer Night, participants are encouraged to bring their own synthesizers, from vintage analog gems to cutting-edge modular wonders. It's a chance to showcase your personal setup, experiment with new equipment, and dive into the rich sonic tapestry that synthesizers offer.
For those looking to enhance the collaborative experience, consider arriving early to connect your synthesizer to a MIDI/CV clock. This allows for synchronized timing among all instruments, creating a seamless musical fusion during impromptu jam sessions.
In addition to the collaborative jam sessions, the event provides a unique opportunity for a show and tell/play with anything that attendees bring. Share your favorite gear, experiment with different setups, and engage in hands-on exploration of various synthesizers and electronic music equipment.
The event unfolds in a relaxed and welcoming atmosphere, providing a platform for musicians, enthusiasts, and curious minds to connect, collaborate, and share their passion for synthesis. Whether you're a beginner seeking guidance or an expert eager to inspire others, Synthesizer Night is the perfect setting to engage in conversations, exchange knowledge, and foster a vibrant community. 
Throughout the evening, you'll have the opportunity to engage in impromptu jam sessions, where the collective energy of multiple synthesizers intertwines to create awe-inspiring sounds. Experience the joy of collaborating with fellow musicians, experiment with different genres and styles, and let the unique characteristics of each instrument shape your sonic explorations.
Additionally, for those who wish to showcase their skills and perform, there will be dedicated performance slots. Take center stage, captivate the audience, and let your creativity soar as you demonstrate the full potential of your synthesizer setup. To sign up for a performance slot, email classes@nycresistor.com or join our Discord and post to #synth.
Whether you're an ardent synth enthusiast, an aspiring musician, or simply curious about the captivating world of synthesizers, Synthesizer Night at NYC Resistor is an event that will inspire, educate, and leave you in awe of the boundless possibilities that electronic sound offers. Don't miss this opportunity to immerse yourself in an evening of music, collaboration, and innovation. Mark your calendars, pack up your favorite synths, and join us at NYC Resistor for a night you won't soon forget. We can't wait to see you there!
This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.

Monthly Amateur Radio club meeting of NYCResistorRadio curious? Join the NYC Resistor Ham Radio Club (call sign N2YCR) for our open and regular meetings, the 4th Wednesday of each month from 8:00 – 9:30 pm at NYC Resistor (87 3rd Avenue, 4th Floor).
The amateur radio hobby has something for everyone, from Morse code to modern digital modes. Bring projects you're working on, gear to fix, problems that puzzle you, outings you'd like to organize, or just yourself to meet & greet your friendly local hams. Drop by the #n2ycr channel in Discord any time to say hi.
You do not need to be a member of Resistor to be a member of the club, nor do you need to be a licensed amateur radio operator (though of course we hope you'll become licensed with our help).
We aim to create an inclusive, encouraging, and diverse environment to bring together Brooklyn's radio hackers, antenna experimenters, shortwave listeners, toroid winders, satellite chasers, and balloon launchers.
Come make some noise in the weird and wonderful medium of radio!This is a masks optional event.
As with all NYC Resistor events, this class is 18+ and governed by our Code of Conduct. The Code of Conduct, as well as accessibility information, can be found at www.nycresistor.com/participate/.
Please note that refunds must be requested 24 hours in advance. If you have any questions, please email classes@nycresistor.com.

events.name: Maximum New York June Party & Abundance Politics Accelerator
events.description: ​Come hang out with friends, hear some lightning talks about NYC city/state politics, find collaborators for your own political schemes, and have a good time!​You'll enjoy the company of MNY alumni, people from theabundance movementgenerally, and other guests.​There will be drinks and snacks!​The formal business agenda will be posted soon. It will include:​Presentations of no more than ~10 minutes​Details on the Abundance Resolution that attendees may vote on.​Updates on city and state politics!​Know before you arrive:This event will be guided by thefour rules of etiquettethat guide all Maximum New York classes, and is generally for people who mostly agree withThe Sensible Seventy.

events.name: OTWC Season 6 Finale and Open Mic
events.description: ​What a year it’s been!​Before we break for the summer, let’s come together for one last celebration with an open mic and party with the OTWC community. We’ll be back in the fall, but first, let’s end the season with a bang.​Over the past year, we’ve written, shared, and grown together. Now’s your chance to show how far you’ve come. Share a snippet of your sci-fi novel, read a poem, or even do a show-and-tell of that Substack you published.​Want to share something?​Sign up for theopen mic here. Each reader will have up to 5 minutes.​Snacks and drinks will be provided, but feel free to bring your own to share too!

events.name: Olive Tree Writing Retreat
events.description: ​We’re hosting our first-ever writing retreat!​Whether you’re working on a novel, a poetry collection, a longform Substack post, or just starting out, this retreat is for anyone looking to dive deep into their writing alongside others on the same journey.​What to expect?​⏰Focused Writing BlocksPlenty of uninterrupted time to go heads down and make real progress on your projects.​🛋Social TimeWe’ll have downtime to rest, play, and connect.​📣Share & CelebrateWrap up the weekend with an intimate open mic-style session. Share a chapter, a poem, or even just a sentence, whatever you want to celebrate, we’ll cheer you on.​How much does it cost?​Tickets will be$500and will include:​✔️ Roundtrip transportation from NYC​✔️ Two nights in a beautiful upstate home​✔️ All meals, snacks, and drinks included​Spots are limitedso we can keep the experience intimate and intentional.​Let’s make it the most productive and inspiring writing weekend of your life.

events.name: Data In Power - NYC Event
events.description: ​Data and the distribution of decision-making power is an increasingly important dynamic to understand and engage with in climate and energy. ​At Data In Power, we believe the method AND end product of data (collection, analysis, and visualization) are critical to decision-making.How are data being collected, analyzed, and presented - why, and by whom? These are the hard-hitting questions we are unpacking.​At this monthly social, we discuss Data In Power fundamentals in a casual setting.**Format**: We will meet for an hour group discussion followed by an optional social hour.Here is avideowith some background on Data In Power's focus within data and the distribution of decision-making power. At all of our events, we gather our community of data and decision-making experts and enthusiasts within climate and energy to share our perspectives.​​Data In Power is an independently run meetup without any bells and whistles.In order to maintain community and continue organic growth, prospective attendees should be prepared to support our meetup venue with a purchase, regardless of how large or small. Data In Power brings folks together through meaningful, productive, and unique programming.

events.name: 108th NY Hardware Meetup @ Betaworks | AI Beyond the Screen | NY Tech Week
events.description: ​​​​The Hardware Meetup community is excited to announce the 108th NY Hardware Meetup at Betaworks!​​​​Hardware Meetupshappen in over 30 cities around the world, bringing together hardware professionals to network and learn from each other.​​​​This month we'll be atBetaworks, the early stage VC and long-time fixture of the NYC tech community. It's a fitting location for our event during NY Tech Week, and we'll be meditating on a fitting topic as well:AI Beyond the Screen.​From robotic systems to intelligent consumer devices, we'll hear about companies working to bring AI into the real world. We're still recruiting presenters and are talking to some incredible companies, but we'd also love to hear fromyou. If you and/or your company are working in robotics, on AI at the edge, or any otherphysicalmanifestation of AI,fill out our speaker formbecause we'd love to feature you at the event. Talks are 10 minutes long,notpitches, and followed by 10 minutes of Q&A.​Even if you don't want to give a full talk, we look forward to hearing from you during the open mic. Bring demos! We're hoping to have some epic hardware in the room.​​SPEAKERS​Follow ourLinkedInpage as we announce them!​Seckin “Sage” Secilmisis the President ofWeb Sensing, a U.S.-based cybersecurity company focused on hardware-based security solutions for critical infrastructure. With over 20 years of experience building products, he has produced mission-critical hardware deployed on land, in the air, in orbit, and even on the Moon.​Will Brighthelped make Backtrack and YellowDog Linux before starting Massdrop at 19. Over the next eight years, Massdrop/DROP shipped 5m+ units of enthusiast hardware; scaling to $100m/year of DTC sales. 90 days before exiting DROP, Will's friend was hit and killed while crossing the road, so he foundedSaferideto eliminate 90% of road deaths with vision models and an edge compute platform for every car on the road.​More soon!​​​AGENDA​​​​6:30 - Arrival, mingle, grab refreshments​​​​7:00 - Welcome and introduction​​7:15- Guest speakers with audience Q+A​​8:20 - Community open mic​​​​Anyone will have the chance or talk about what they are working on.​​8:30 - Mix + mingle​​WANT TO GET INVOLVED?​​​Sponsorship:​We offer exclusive access to our 10,000+ member community through sponsorships.​​​Host an event at your space:We are always looking for host sponsors to provide access to unique spaces from cool hardware companies building interesting things. Want to open up your office?​​​Speaker:Do you have something interesting to share with our community? We're on the lookout for fresh faces to talk about their journey and experiences.​​​If you want to get involved, head here:https://linktr.ee/nyhardware

events.name: Female Founders Unwind - La Creme de la STEM™
events.description: ​Join us for unwinding in great company during New York Tech Week! Show up as you are, honore where you are at and mingle with fellow female founders.​AGENDA:​9 - 9:30am: check-in and networking​9:30 - 10am: pitches of Founding Members of La Creme de la STEM™​Abby Rakshit, CEO and Founder atSeason​Yasaman Soroori, CEO and co-founder atConsulta​Holly Diamond, CEO and Founder atWork Onward​Saba Ahmed, co-founder at Tiny Dinner​Jennifer Dwork, co-founder atBummed​Elisabeth Bykoff, CEO and founder atBoxsy​Victoire Mandonnaud, CEO and founder ofOn My Way​Kristin Scholten, Stealth​10 - 10:15am: breath and relax withLizzy Palmer, CEO and co-founder ofSync N​10:15am - 11am: more networking​​ABOUT LA CREME DE LA STEM™:​​​La Creme de la STEM™is the only global, private network for early-stage female founders in tech and science, offering a holistic support system that includes exclusive insights from exited entrepreneurs, vetted investors and perks from corporate partners.Applyto join!​ABOUT CITIZENS​Citizens Private Bankprovides holistic, high-touch client service to startups, venture capital, and private equity firms. We are a trusted partner to established venture capital funds & emerging managers, founders, and LP's, and corporates for Citizens Private Bank. We offer tailored financial solutions and expert guidance. With a rich legacy of supporting innovation and entrepreneurship, we specialize in providing comprehensive banking services to meet the unique needs of the innovation economy with an unprecedented customer service and support.​ABOUT FOLEY HOAG​Foley Hoag lawyers have a long track record of partnering with high growth companies and the investors powering the innovation, on their journey from idea to exit. We have a deep understanding for the passion, grit and flexibility entrepreneurs require from their partners to be successful. For more information on Foley Hoag, visit:www.foleyhoag.com​ABOUT SOURMILK​Founded by two best friends who met at Stanford, Elan and Kiki are on a mission to heal America's gut through real whole foods, starting one yogurt at a time! Sourmilk (@getsourmilk) has all the probiotic benefits of a supplement but in the form of a thick and creamy dairy yogurt packed with protein and healthy fats. We are excited for you to try it!

events.name: NYC Intern Summer Kickoff
events.description: ​🏙️NYC Intern Summer Kickoff​The Summer Kickoff You've Been Waiting For​Special Announcement:We are bringing the most exclusive intern experience to NYC this summer.​After seeing too many brilliant interns settle for generic corporate mixers, we decided to create something different. Something that matches the energy of the city that never sleeps and the ambition of the next generation building it.​NYC Intern Summer Kickoffis the premier summer kickoff event for elite interns who think bigger, move faster, and refuse to blend in.​🚀What Makes This Different​This isn't your typical networking event. This is where:​Top Gen Z founders who built million-dollar companies before 25share the playbook​Creator-entrepreneurs crushing it on multiple platformsreveal their strategies​NYC's most ambitious internsconnect with their future co-founders​Real talk, real connections, real opportunitieshappen​🎯The Experience​6:30 PM - 7:00 PM:Welcome ReceptionPremium networking with curated intro connections + CPG brand snacks​7:00 PM - 8:00 PM:Founder-Creator Panel"From Intern to Icon: Building Your Empire Before 25"​Featuring Gen Z founders who:​Turned internships into acquisition offers​Built personal brands with 100K+ engaged followers​Launched companies that VCs actually funded​Created multiple revenue streams before graduation​8:00 PM - 8:30 PM:Empire MixerFinal networking with fellow interns, founders, and industry operators​💎Who Should Attend​✅Summer interns(Tech, Finance, Consulting, Media)✅Aspiring founderswith side projects already in motion✅Content creatorsbuilding their personal brand✅Students/recent gradsinterning in NYC metro area✅Anyone who sees their internship as a stepping stone, not the destination​🏆Featured Panelists​Curating NYC's most impressive Gen Z founder-creators who built empires while their peers were still figuring out their majors.​Panel lineup dropping soon...​🤝Event Partners & Co-Hosts​​The Collective NY: Exclusive community for top young talent, building opportunities for NYC's most ambitious young leaders​​Jonas - Cofounder of The Collective.Connect with him here.​​Maggie - Cofounder of The Collective.Connect with her here.​This event is brought to you by a collective of ambitious operators and founders who believe in elevating the next generation.​Each co-host brings their unique expertise and network to create an unmatched experience for attendees.​📍Venue​Premium Manhattan location(Exact address sent with confirmation)Time:6:30 PM - 8:30 PM ESTDress Code:Come as you are​🎟️Registration​100% FREE- Because we believe in investing in the next generation​Full panel + mixer access​Premium snacks from emerging CPG brands​Limited to 150 attendees - first come, first served​We will personally review and accept the most impressive applications.​💭Why We Are Hosting This​As a group who's built multiple companies and invested in dozens of startups, we see the same pattern: the interns who win big are the ones who think like founders from day one.​They don't just complete assignments—they identify opportunities.They don't just network—they build genuine relationships.They don't just consume content—they create value.​This event is for the 1% of interns who already think this way, and the 10% who are ready to level up.​We covering all costs because we believe the next generation of founders deserves the same opportunities we had—regardless of their bank account.​Your internship is just the beginning. events.name: DeSciNYC: Genome Editing in Early Human Embryos
events.description: ​Genome editing tools allow the introduction of precise changes in the DNA. For this ability, they became indispensable for basic biological research and hold great promise for future therapeutic applications. The same technologies are being utilized also in early human embryos for better understanding of key developmental regulators and DNA repair mechanisms. In the future, precise correction of specific genes might enable curing devastating diseases early in the development or decreasing the risks of certain diseases. Although continuous research is needed before such an intervention becomes safe, the first gene-edited babies were already born. This talk aims to contribute to the debate about human germline gene editing by putting it into a broader context of human biology, discussing the benefits, current limitations, and possible future alternatives leading to the prevention of genetic diseases.Stepan Jerabek is a postdoctoral research scientist in the Pediatrics Department at Columbia University. He is also an associate scientist at IOCB Prague, an institute of the Czech Academy of Sciences. Stepan’s interest in early development and genome stability brought him to the Egli laboratory, where he uses genome editing tools to study DNA repair in human preimplantation embryos. In 2024, Stepan was the recipient of the Druckenmiller Fellowship Award from the New York Stem Cell Foundation Research Institute. Stepan completed his doctoral training at the Max Planck Institute for Molecular Biomedicine in Germany and was a research fellow at Harvard Medical School, working in the lab of genetics pioneer George Church.🐦Stay Connected about Future Events:Twitter:@descinyc_Instagram:@descinyc​PS: Apply to be a member of the DeSci NYC group chat:https://forms.gle/AmUtotmCgWgGxWDp6

events.name: Startup Friends - Meditative Walk w/ Satori
events.description: ​You survived Tech Week. Panels. Pitches. Pings. Your brain feels like a tab you forgot to close.​If you have to explain what you do one more time, you might explode. So now what?​Zen out or burn out.​The meditative walkis a slow, tech-free walk through Central Park. Phones on airplane mode. No pitches. No pretending to be “on.”​Just actual humans, moving slowly, enjoying nature and breathing like it’s 1996.​Join a crew of ambitious, slightly-fried New Yorkers as we unplug, walk, and remember how to be human again.

events.name: Founder Debate Night By Antler & Satori
events.description: ​Two teams. One motion. Wildly strong opinions - whether you believe them or not.​Here’s how it works:​We’ll throw out a spicy topic. Teams take sides. Each person gets a chance to make their case, throw a little shade (respectfully, of course), and see who can win over the crowd.​The best arguments? Loud applause.The worst ones? Probably still loud applause.​No debate experience needed. Just bring your brain, your sense of humor, and your willingness to argue passionately about things thatmay or may notmatter.
